concept.title: Handling timeouts
concept.shortdesc: The SDK supports configuration options to control the various timeouts that application developers may wish to override so that they can fine-tune their applications.

conbody.p: Internally the client uses a set of heuristics and accompanying logic to determine whether or not to retry operations if they fail with a timeout or to return a failure message to the calling application. In general, an application should not provide additional logic in the case that a timeout error is returned; however, it’s likely an indication that the application configuration may be in need of ‘tuning’ or that perhaps a broader system or network level issue may be at play.

section.title: Client Timeout Configuration
section.p: The following time-out’s are configurable either through the App.Config/Web.Config or through the ClientConfiguration object itself:

row.entry: The amount of time to wait on a binary operation before timing out.
The amount of time to wait on a View query before timing out
The amount of time to wait on a N1QL query before timing out
The amount of time to wait for an available TCP connection before timing out
The amount of time to spend waiting for an Observe operation to meet it’s durability requirements before timing out
The time between when the SDK closes a TCP connection and when it actually shuts down
